message:
"Railway Lullaby"

In the waning light, they found unity,
Trapped on steel serpents, hearts driven alive,
As silence shrilled in the blackened cavity,
In patience, they thrived, their spirits contrived,
Not marooned, but an absurd assembly,
Shadows dancing on the rhythm of survival's dive.
prompt: Watchdog calls for investigation after thousands trapped in trains in London London’s passenger watchdog has called for an investigation after thousand of people were trapped on trains on Thursday evening when power lines were damaged. Passengers, who were given little information during the ordeal, were stuck for more than three hours on dark, cold trains – including on Elizabeth line trains, which have no toilets and rely on the overhead lines for power.
